title: How can I recognize mail fraud?
main_content:
Tip
	The US Postal Service has a lot of information about how to identify, prevent, and deal with mail fraud . In addition, the US Postal Inspection Service provides tips on different types of mail fraud  and where to report suspicious mail, mail theft, and postage fraud .

    
    

    
    
    
        Some common types of high-risk mail you may receive are:Notices of prizes, sweepstakes winnings, vacations, and other offers to claim valuable itemsPersonal appeals for money or information from people you do not knowLetters from psychics or religious figures offering to predict or change your future
key_message: While the specific scams change everyday, a common warning sign is a letter asking you to send money or personal information now to receive something of value later.
